biolockj.util

Class BashScriptBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.util.BashScriptBuilder

  • public class BashScriptBuilder
extends Object
    This utility class generates the bash script files using the lines provided and Config script properties.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String CLASSIFIER_JOB_HEADER
      Config property to use in cluster jobHeader .
      : "cluster.classifierHeader"
      Header written at top of QIIME OTU picking worker scripts
      protected static String CLUSTER_BATCH_COMMAND
      Config String property: "cluster.batchCommand"
      Terminal command used to submit jobs on the cluster.
      protected static String CLUSTER_MODULES
      Config List property: "cluster.modules"
      List of cluster modules to load at start of worker scripts.
      protected static List<String> CLUSTER_NUM_PROCESSORS
      One parameter of the Config String property "cluster.jobHeader" to set number of cores.
      protected static String CLUSTER_VALIDATE_PARAMS
      Config Boolean property: "cluster.validateParams"
      If set to "Y", validate "cluster.jobHeader" param cluster number of processors = "script.numThreads" or "cluster.numClassifierThreads"
      protected static String ERROR_DETECTED
      Script variable set true if any script error occurs: "errorDetected"
      protected static String ERROR_ON_PREVIOUS_LINE
      Script variable set true if a script errors on previous line: "errorOnPreviousLine"
      protected static String EXIT_CODE
      Script variable to store exit code of previous statement: "exitCode"
      protected static String FAIL_FILE
      Script variable to store path of file where error messages will be saved: "failureFile"
      protected static String FUNCTION_RUN_JOB
      Main script function to submit jobs on the cluster
      protected static String LINE
      Script variable to store the next script line to execute: "line"
      protected static String LINE_NUM
      Script variable to store the line number of the current executable statement: "line"
      static String QSUB_DIR
      Name of the module directory where cluster job output/error files are to be created: "qsub"
      protected static String SCRIPT_JOB_HEADER
      Config String property: "cluster.jobHeader"
      Header written at top of worker scripts

                                List<List<String>> data,
                                int batchSize)
                         throws Exception

        Parameters:

        data - Bash script lines
        batchSize - Number of samples to process per worker script

        Exception - if any error occurs

        Returns:

      • createScript

        protected static File createScript(String scriptPath,
                                   List<String> lines)
                            throws Exception
        Create the script. Leading zeros added if needed so all worker scripts have same number of digits. Print the worker script as DEBUG to the log file.
        Parameters:
        scriptPath - Worker script path
        lines - Ordered bash script lines to write to the scriptPath
        Returns:
        File bash script
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur

        protected static List<String> getMainScriptLines(ScriptModule module,
                                                 String workerScriptPath,
                                                 String workerId)
                                          throws Exception
        Wrap lines in the MAIN script that call a worker script in control code.
        Parameters:

        workerScriptPath - Worker script path
        workerId - Worker script ID
        Returns:

      • getWorkerScriptLines

        protected static List<String> getWorkerScriptLines(String scriptPath,
                                                   List<String> lines)
                                            throws Exception
        Lines are wrapped in control statements to allow exit of script based on a single failure, or to simply track if any failure occur (if exitOnFailure=N). Exit codes are capture in the event of a failure to saved to the FAIL_FILE.
        Parameters:
        scriptPath - Path to script file
        lines - Basic script lines generated by a BioModule.
        Returns:
        List of wrapped worker script lines
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur

      • getWorkerScriptPath

        protected static String getWorkerScriptPath(ScriptModule module,
                                            String workerId)
                                     throws Exception
        Build the file path for the numbered worker script. Leading zeros added if needed so all worker scripts have same number of digits.
        Parameters:
        module - ScriptModule is the module that owns the scripts
        workerId - Worker ID
        Returns:
        Absolute path of next worker script
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur

      • initMainScript

        protected static List<String> initMainScript(ScriptModule module)
                                      throws Exception
        Create the ScriptModule main script that calls all worker scripts.
        Parameters:
        module - ScriptModule script directory is where main script is written
        Returns:
        List of lines for the main script that has the prefix
        Throws:
        Exception - if error occurs writing the file

      • initWorkerScript

        protected static List<String> initWorkerScript(ScriptModule module,
                                               String scriptPath)
                                        throws Exception
        Create the numbered worker scripts. Leading zeros added if needed so all worker scripts names are the same length. If run on cluster and cluster.jobHeader is defined, add cluster.jobHeader as header for worker scripts. Otherwise, use the same script.defaultHeader as used in the MAIN script.
        Parameters:
        module - ScriptModule script directory is where main script is written
        scriptPath - Worker script absolute file path
        Returns:
        Lines for the worker script
        Throws:
        Exception - if required properties are undefined

      • verifyConfig

        protected static void verifyConfig(ScriptModule module)
                            throws Exception
        If property "project.env" = cluster, require property "cluster.batchCommand", otherwise exit this method.

        If running on the cluster and property "cluster.validateParams" = "Y":

        1. Require property "cluster.jobHeader"
        2. Require property "cluster.batchCommand" sets #cores param (ppn or procs) = "script.numThreads" or "cluster.numClassifierThreads"

        Current format #1 (2018) for UNCC HPC Cluster: #PBS -l procs=1,mem=8GB,walltime=8:00:00
        Current format #2 (2018) for UNCC HPC Cluster: #PBS -l ppn=1,mem=8GB,walltime=8:00:00

        Parameters:
        module - ScriptModuel
        Throws:
        Exception - if any validation fails

      • wrapScriptLine

        protected static List<String> wrapScriptLine(String scriptPath,
                                             boolean isWorker)
        This method requires that the variable $"line" holds an executable shell statement.
        Wrapping code:
        1. Save executing line number to $"lineNum"
        2. Execute script line $"line".
        3. Capture $"exitCode" to determine execution status
        4. If the $"line" failed:
          • Set "errorDetected"=true
          • If isWorker, set "errorOnPreviousLine"=true
        Parameters:
        scriptPath - Path to script file
        isWorker - Set true if building worker script
        Returns:
        List of wrapped lines

      • writeScript

        protected static void writeScript(BufferedWriter writer,
                                  List<String> lines)
                           throws Exception
        This method formats the bash script to indent if statement code blocks
        Parameters:
        writer - BufferedWriter writes to the file
        lines - List or shell script lines
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur
